intro: Hieraciodes alpestris, commonly known as alpine thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and aromatic, needle-like leaves. The plant typically thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its compact growth habit and hardy nature make it a popular choice for alpine gardens and rockeries. Hieraciodes alpestris is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
